Package com.metal.kit.vapor.characters

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
com.metal.kit.vapor.characters.Character
com.metal.kit.vapor.characters.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Playable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cctv, Dog, Guard
public abstract class Enemy extends Character
Abstract class representing an enemy in the game.

An enemy is capable of detecting the player within its detection range, pursuing the player if they enter its detection area, and reacting based on the position and orientation of the player. Specific enemy types should extend this class to implement their own behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(String name, float x, float y, int health, int damage, float speed, float zoneX, float zoneY, float zoneWidth, float zoneHeight, float detectionDistance, float detectionRadius, float detectionDirection)
      Constructor to create an enemy with specific parameters for movement zone, detection range, and alert behavior.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the enemy.
      x - The initial X position of the enemy.
      y - The initial Y position of the enemy.
      health - The health points of the enemy.
      damage - The damage dealt by the enemy.
      speed - The speed at which the enemy moves.
      zoneX - The X position of the enemy's movement zone.
      zoneY - The Y position of the enemy's movement zone.
      zoneWidth - The width of the enemy's movement zone.
      zoneHeight - The height of the enemy's movement zone.
      detectionDistance - The detection range of the enemy.
      detectionRadius - The angular detection radius of the enemy.
      detectionDirection - The direction of detection, in degrees.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move(float delta, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map)
      Moves the enemy based on the map. This method is called during the game's update loop.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Playable
      Overrides:
      move in class Character
      Parameters:
      delta - The time elapsed since the last update (in seconds).
      map - The map used to check for collisions.

    • detectPlayer

      public boolean detectPlayer(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 enemyPosition, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 playerPosition)
      Checks if the enemy detects the player based on distance and angle.

      An enemy detects the player if the distance between the enemy and the player is less than the detection range, and if the player is within the angular detection radius of the enemy.

      Parameters:
      enemyPosition - The position of the enemy.
      playerPosition - The position of the player.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy detects the player, false otherwise.

    • pursuitPlayer

      public void pursuitPlayer(Player player, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map, float deltaTime)
      Makes the enemy pursue the player based on the player's position. The enemy will move towards the player while considering the direction of its movement (left or right), and the orientation of the sprite will be updated accordingly.

      If the enemy changes direction based on the player's position, the sprite's orientation will also be updated.

      Parameters:
      player - The player that the enemy is pursuing.
      map - The map used to check for collisions.
      deltaTime - The time elapsed since the last update (in seconds).

    • triggerAlert

      public void triggerAlert()
      This method is called when the enemy triggers an alert. It can be implemented by enemy subclasses to add specific behavior when the alert is triggered.

    • update

      public void update(Player player, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map, float delta)
      Updates the state of the enemy. This method can be extended by subclasses to add specific behaviors during each game frame.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for interactions.
      map - The game map.
      delta - The time elapsed since the last update (in seconds).

    • render

      public void render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
      Renders the enemy on the screen. This method is used to draw the enemy with the `SpriteBatch`.
      Overrides:
      render in class Character
      Parameters:
      batch - The rendering batch to draw the enemy.
